Package Model

Class Segment

java.lang.Object
Model.Segment
public class Segment extends Object
Segment is the class representing a road segment.
A segment is characterized by:
  • A departure intersection which is the origin of the segment.
  • An arrival intersection which is the end of the segment.
  • A length which is the length of the segment in meters.
  • A name which is the name of the segment.
Segments are created when loading a map by parsing an XML map file.
Author:
H4122
See Also:
Controller.parseMap(org.w3c.dom.Document)

    • Segment

      public Segment​(Intersection departureIntersection, Intersection arrivalIntersection, float length, String name)
      Constructor of Segment. When the segment is created, the departureIntersection, the length, the arrivalIntersection and the name are initialized with the corresponding parameters.
      Parameters:
      departureIntersection - The departure intersection of the segment.
      arrivalIntersection - The arrival intersection of the segment.
      length - The length of the segment.
      name - The name of the segment.
      See Also:
      departureIntersection, arrivalIntersection, length, name

    • equals

      public boolean equals​(Object obj)
      Overrides equals method in Object class. Compares the object in parameter to this segment. The specified object is identical to this segment if it is a segment and it has the same departure intersection id, same arrival intersection id, the same length and the same name as this segment.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to be compared with.
      Returns:
      TRUE if the specified object and this segment are identical, FALSE otherwise.
